com.github.fge.jsonschema.format

Class FormatAttribute

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.fge.jsonschema.format.FormatAttribute
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractDateFormatAttribute, EmailFormatAttribute, HostnameFormatAttribute, IPV4FormatAttribute, IPV6FormatAttribute, MediaTypeFormatAttribute, PhoneNumberFormatAttribute, RegexFormatAttribute, UnixEpochFormatAttribute, URIFormatAttribute

    public abstract class FormatAttribute
extends Object
    Base class for a format attribute

    The format keyword always takes a string as an argument, and this string is called a "attribute". See FormatAttributes for the list of supported attributes.

    One important thing to remember is that a attribute will only validate a given subset of JSON instance types (for instance, uri only validates string instances). In the event that the instane type is not of the validated types, validation succeeds.

    JSON Schema specifications allow for custom attributes to be added. This implementation supports it.

    Final note: even though you may register format attributes to validate container instances, drafts also explicitly says that you should not do so.

    See Also:
    KeywordRegistry

    • Constructor Detail

      • FormatAttribute

        protected FormatAttribute(NodeType first,
               NodeType... other)
        Protected constructor

        Its arguments are the node types recognized by the attribute. Only one attribute recognizes more than one type: utc-millisec (it can validate both numbers and integers).

        Parameters:
        first - first type
        other - other types, if any

    • Method Detail

      • validate

        public final void validate(String fmt,
            ValidationReport report,
            JsonNode value)
        Main validation function

        This function only checks whether the value is of a type recognized by this attribute. If so, it calls checkValue(String, ValidationReport, JsonNode).

        The message template passed as an argument will have been pre-filled with the keyword (format), the attribute name and the domain (Domain.VALIDATION).

        Parameters:
        fmt - the format attribute name
        report - the validation report
        value - the value to validate

      • checkValue

        public abstract void checkValue(String fmt,
              ValidationReport report,
              JsonNode value)
        Abstract method implemented by all attributes

        It is only called if the value type is one expected by the attribute, see validate(String, ValidationReport, JsonNode).

        Parameters:
        fmt - the format attribute name
        report - the validation report
        value - the value to validate

        protected static Message.Builder newMsg(String fmt)
